div1.p: Mr. Edmond van Ectvelde, Administrator General of the Department of Foreign Affairs of the Independent State of the Congo, Brussels.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 1st ultimo, in which you are pleased to proffer, throught me, to the Government of the United States of America, an offical guarantee of the neutrality of the newly constituted Independent State of the Congvo, and whereby you acquaint me with the boundary demarkation of the new State.
guarantee of neutrality is made by you in conformity with Article 10 of the General Act of the Conference of Berlin.

The Government of the United States having been represented by Delegates in that Conference under the expressed reservations of the right, in its sovereign discretion thereafter to accede or withhold its accession, to the result of its deliberaitons, it will not be possible for me to determine the due and proper weight to be given by this Government to the declaraion and territorial claims thus communicated by you on behald of the Independent State of the Congo, so far as such declaration and claim rest on the provisions of that General Act, until the United States shall, by subsequent accession, and ratification
of the said General Act of the Conference of Berlin, in the manner therein provided and according to their constitutional forms, become a party to the stipulation thereof.

The relationship of cordial recognition and earnest good will, heretofore initiated by the Government of the United States toward the International Association of the Congo, and now confirmed and, I trust, perpetuated in respect of the new Independent State which succeeds to that Association, is, however, complete of itself and apart from any conventional relationship flowing from or defined by the General Act of the Conference of Berlin; and the obligation to respect the precepts of neutrality and friendly intercourse is held by the Government of the
United States to be as perfect toward the sovereign and Independent State of the Congo as toward any and all sovereignties with which the United States maintain friendship and intercourse.
Accept, Sir, the renewed assurance of my highest consideration.
